modules.serial_labware.IKA_RV package¶

Submodules¶

modules.serial_labware.IKA_RV.IKA_RV10 module¶

:mod:”IKA_RV10” – API for IKA RV10 remote controllable rotary evaporator¶

  1. 2017 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This provides a python class for the IKA RV 10 rotary evaporator with IKA HB 10 heating bath. The command implementation is not based on the manual since the manual list different/wrong commands for the rotavap and no commands for the bath at all. The correct commands were worked out in correspondence with IKA and by trial and error.

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

class modules.serial_labware.IKA_RV.IKA_RV10.IKARV10(port=None, device_name=None, connect_on_instantiation=False, soft_fail_for_testing=False)[source]¶

Bases: SerialDevice.serial_labware.SerialDevice

This provides a python class for the IKA RV 10 rotary evaporator with IKA HB 10 heating bath. The command implementation is not based on the manual since the manual list different/wrong commands for the rotavap and no commands for the bath at all. The correct commands were worked out in correspondence with IKA and by trial and error.

initialise()[source]¶

Due to unspeakable firmware dumbfuckery both rotavap and heating bath only actually enter remote mode after a start command has been sent. This method starts and stops both devices to force them into remote mode. :return: True if successful, False if not

keepalive()[source]¶

Queries heating bath temperature every 2 seconds if the heating is on to keep it alive. Overrides dummy keepalive from parent method. This does not utilise the non_blocking_wait method because passing a property as callback leads to unwanted behaviour (i.e. property gets read on every loop iteration, not just every x seconds). self.last_time is initialised in the parent method.

lift_up()[source]¶
name¶

Returns the name of the rotavap :return: call back to send_message with a request to return the name

reset_rotavap()[source]¶
rotation_speed_pv¶

Reads the process variable (i.e. the current) rpm :return: call back to send_message with a request to return and check a value

rotation_speed_sp¶

Reads the set point (target) for the rpm :return: call back to send_message with a request to return and check a value

safety_temp¶
set_interval(interval)[source]¶

Sets the interval length in seconds for the interval mode. Setting this to 0 stops the function :param interval: (int) the interval in seconds (1-60)

set_interval_sp(interval=None)[source]¶

Sets the time for the interval operation. Here it rotates in one direction for a time, then reverts the direction, and so forth.

Parameters:interval (int) – desired interval time in seconds. “0” deactivates interval mode.
set_timer(time_setpoint)[source]¶

Sets the time in minutes for the timer mode. Setting this to 0 stops the function :param time_setpoint: (int) the time in minutes (1-199)

software_version¶

Returns the software version of the firmware !!!WARNING!!! Despite being documented this does not seem to work as intended, it just returns an empty string :return: (supposed to…) software version of the firmware
